alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:05PM EST until January 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes affecting Morris, Passaic and Bergen Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Pompton Lakes...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River at Pompton Lakes. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Nuisance, low lying flooding, occurs near the dam in the Pompton Lakes. At 11.5 feet, South section of Pompton Lakes experiences flooding. At 12.5 feet, Several residences in Pompton Lakes, along Riveredge Drive, take on water. At 13.5 feet, Hamburg Turnpike is closed between Route 202 and Riverview Road. Many residences are flooded south of Dawes Highway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM EST Wednesday was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Thursday morning and continue falling to 10.2 feet Saturday evening. Some additional rises are forecast Saturday night into Sunday, but below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 12/24/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Ramapo River Pompton Lakes 11.5 12.8 Wed 9 pm 9.9 9.2 10.3 1pm 1/13 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1015 AM EST.
